sen.j: 五箇条の御誓文（ごかじょうのごせいもん）とは、明治元年3月14日 (旧暦)（1868年4月6日）に明治天皇（当時15歳）が公卿や諸侯などに示した明治政府の基本方針。
sen.e: Charter Oath of Five Articles was basic policy of the Meiji government represented to Kugyo (court nobles) and lords by the Emperor Meiji (15 years old at that time) on April 6, 1868.

sen.e: Hereinafter referred to as Charter Oath, proper name of Charter Oath of Five Articles.

sen.j: 明治新政府は発足当初から公議を標榜し、その具体的方策としての国是を模索していた。
sen.e: From the beginning of inauguration, the New Meiji Government advocated fair discussion and sought national policy as the concrete measure.
From the beginning of inauguration, the New Meiji Government advocated fair discussion and sought national policy as the concrete measure.

sen.j: 明治元年正月、福井藩出身の参与由利公正が、坂本龍馬の船中八策と似ている部分が多い議事之体大意五箇条を起案し、参与東久世通禧を通じて議定兼副総裁の岩倉具視に提出した。
sen.e: New Year in 1868, Sanyo, Kosei YURI from Fukui Domain made up Gijinoteitaii Five Articles which was similar much to Senchu hassaku (the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma Sakamoto) of Ryoma SAKAMOTO and submitted to gijo (official post) and vice-president, Tomomi IWAKURA through Sanyo (councillor), Michitomi HIGASHIKUZE.

New Year in 1868, Sanyo (councilor), Kosei YURI from Fukui Domain made up Gijinoteitaii Five Articles which was partially similar to Senchu hassaku (the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma SAKAMOTO) and submitted to gijo (official post) and vice-president, Tomomi IWAKURA through Sanyo, Michitomi HIGASHIKUZE.
sen.cmt: 参与（Sanyo)が初出時に説明されていないため、訂正。Similar much to → particially similar toに変更。()内にby Ryoma Sakamotoと明記されているため、of Ryoma SAKAMOTOを削除。（）Sakamoto→SAKAMOTOのに変更。
sen.e: New Year in 1868, Sanyo (councilor), Kosei YURI from Fukui Domain made up Gijinoteitaii Five Articles which was partially similar to Senchu hassaku (the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma SAKAMOTO) and submitted to gijo (official post) and vice-president, Tomomi IWAKURA through Sanyo, Michitomi HIGASHIKUZE.

sen.j: 制度取調参与の福岡孝弟は、この由利五箇条に対して第一条冒頭に「列侯会議を興し」の字句を入れるなどして封建的な方向へ後退させ、表題も会盟に改めたため、列侯会盟の色彩が非常に強くなった。
sen.e: Because Seido torishirabe Sanyo (Councilor in charge of examining regulations) Takachika FUKUOKA added words 'setting up a council by feudal lords' at the beginning of the first article of Yuri gokajo (Five Articles designed by Yuri), it stepped back to feudalistic direction and also because of the change of title to kaimei the mood of pledge of feudal lords deepened.

Because Seido torishirabe Sanyo (Councilor in charge of examining regulations) Takachika FUKUOKA added words 'setting up a council by feudal lords' at the beginning of the first article of the Yuri gokajo (Five Articles designed by Yuri) and the title was changed to "kaimei" (pledge of feudal lords), it stepped back to feudalistic direction and the mood of pledge of feudal lords deepened.
sen.cmt: ※Yuri gokajoは既出のGijinoteitaii Five Articlesのことであるため、Yuri gokajoの前にthe を挿入しました。※Kaimei（会盟）の説明がありません。用語集を参照し補いました。※全体的に文章の流れを変更しました。以下、全角で‘’となっている部分はすべて半角に変更しました。(変更箇所が非常に多いため、変更箇所全部に変更理由を記載することはできませんでしたが、これが理由で変更を行った場合のみ（他の変更理由がない場合のみ）コメントにその旨を記載しました。
sen.e: Because Seido torishirabe Sanyo (Councilor in charge of examining regulations) Takachika FUKUOKA added words 'setting up a council by feudal lords' at the beginning of the first article of the Yuri gokajo (Five Articles designed by Yuri) and the title was changed to "kaimei" (pledge of feudal lords), it stepped back to feudalistic direction and the mood of pledge of feudal lords deepened.

sen.j: さらに福岡は発表の形式として天皇と諸侯が共に会盟を約する形を提案した。
sen.e: Fukuoka also proposed to commitment to kaimei of the emperor and lords as an announcement.
Fukuoka also requested the Emperor's and lords's commitment to kaimei as an announcement.

sen.j: しかし、この「会盟」形式は、天皇と諸侯とを対等に扱うものであり王政復古 (日本)の理念に反するという批判にさらされた。
sen.e: However this 'kaimei' which treated equally the emperor and lords was criticized that it was against the principle of Restoration of Imperial Rule.

sen.j: そこで、総裁局顧問の木戸孝允が、天皇が天神地祗（てんじんちぎ。分かり易く言えば神）を祀り、神前で公卿・諸侯を率いている状態で共に誓いかつ全員が署名するという形式を提案し、採用されることとなった。
sen.e: Therefore general bureau adviser Takayoshi KIDO proposed that the emperor enshrined tenjinchigi (the gods of heaven and earth) and pledged and singed together with Kugyo (court noble) and lords in front of the alter and it was adopted.

Therefore general bureau adviser Takayoshi KIDO proposed another form that the emperor pray to tenjinchigi (the gods of heaven and earth) as leader of Kugyo and lords, then pledge and sign together with them, and the proposal was adopted.
sen.cmt: emperor→Emperorにしました。全体的に変更しました。特に「祀り」の部分はenshrine（安置する）ではなく祈願する(pray to)に改めました。

sen.j: その際、木戸孝允は、福岡案第一条の「列侯会議を興し」を「広ク会議ヲ興シ」に改め、「徴士」の任用期間を制限していた福岡案第五条を削除して木戸最終案第四条を新たに組み込み、五箇条の順序を体裁良く整え直すなどして大幅に変更を加え、より普遍的な内容にした。
sen.e: At that time, Takayoshi KIDO revised 'setting up a council by feudal lords' in the first article of Fukuoka's draft to 'setting up a council widely' and deleted the article 5 which restricted the term of 'chosi' (official) and added newly the article 4 of Kido's final draft and put the order of the article 5 in proper order and the contents became more universal by those big changes.

sen.cmt: revised→changedに変更しました。‘setting up a council widely’→‘setting up deliberative assmblies widely’に変更しました。五箇条と第五条の違いがわかりにくいため、五箇条はwhole five Articlesに変更しました。

sen.j: また、議定兼副総裁の三条実美も福岡案表題の「会盟」を「誓」に修正したため、木戸による五箇条が「誓文」「御誓文」「五箇条誓文」「五箇条の御誓文」と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: Also gijo (official post) and a vice-president Sanetomi SANJO revised 'kaimei' of the title of Fukuoka's draft to 'oath', therefore Five Articles of Kito was called 'Seimon' 'Goseimon' (oath), 'Gokajo Seimon' 'Gokajo no Goseimon' (Charter Oath of Five Articles).

Also gijo (official post) and a vice-president Sanetomi SANJO changed 'kaimei' of the title of Fukuoka's draft to 'oath,' therefore Five Articles by Kido was called 'Seimon,' 'Goseimon,' 'Gokajo Seimon,' or 'Gokajo no Goseimon.'
sen.cmt: revised→changedに変更しました。of Kito→by Kidoに変更しました。ここで五箇条の呼び方を紹介しているので、それぞれ（）内の意味は省きました。

sen.e: This Kido gokajo (Five Articles designed by Kido) was approved by the Emperor Meiji as Japanese national policy to be declared in the worlds and was pledged on March 14, 1868 just as Kido targeted to ensure the large scale of Imperial court to the world.

sen.j: 木戸は後日、「天下の侯伯と誓い、億兆の向ふ所を知らしめ、藩主をして其責に任ぜんと欲し」たと述べている。
sen.e: Kito stated later 'it pledged with kohaku (nobles), showed the direction for gazillion of people and gave the lords of domains responsibilities'.
Kido stated later that he aimed 'to pledge with kohaku (nobles), show the direction for people and give the lords of domains responsibilities.'

sen.e: Kido stated later that he aimed 'to pledge with kohaku (nobles), show the direction for people and give the lords of domains responsibilities.'

sen.j: 御誓文は明治天皇の勅命によって、3月13日 (旧暦)に天皇の書道指南役であった有栖川宮幟仁親王の手で正本が揮毫され、翌3月14日 (旧暦)、京都御所の正殿である京都御所紫宸殿で行われた天神地祇御誓祭という儀式によって示された。
sen.e: The original of Charter Oath was written by Prince Arisugawa Takahito on royal command of the Emperor Meiji on March 13 and showed in the ceremony, Tenjinchigigoseisai (the gods of heaven and earth pledge festival) held at the main building, Kyoto Imperial Palace Shishinden hall on March 14.

The original of Charter Oath was written by Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito who gave the Emperor instructions in calligraphy on royal command of the Emperor Meiji on March 13 (old lunar calendar) and shown in the ceremony, Tenjinchigigoseisai (the gods of heaven and earth festival for oath) held at the main building, Kyoto Imperial Palace Shishinden hall on March 14 (old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 1.用語統一リストに基づき変更しました。：有栖川宮幟仁親王→Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito2.書道指南役追記しました。3.(旧暦）が明示されていなかったため、（）付けで追記。（年号がないため、新暦の日付が割り出せません。）4.showed→shownに変更しました。5.御誓祭→用語集の登録を参考に（）内変更しました。
sen.e: The original of Charter Oath was written by Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito who gave the Emperor instructions in calligraphy on royal command of the Emperor Meiji on March 13 (old lunar calendar) and shown in the ceremony, Tenjinchigigoseisai (the gods of heaven and earth festival for oath) held at the main building, Kyoto Imperial Palace Shishinden hall on March 14 (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 天神地祇御誓祭の前には、天皇の書簡である御宸翰が披瀝されている。

sen.e: Before Tenjinchigigoseisai, Shinkan (a letter in the Emperor's own hand) was presented.

sen.j: 同日正午、在京の公卿・諸侯・徴士ら群臣が着座。

At noon on the same day, Kugyo, lords and choshi in Kyoto were seated.

sen.j: 議定兼副総裁の三条実美が天皇に代わって神前で御祭文を奉読。
sen.e: Gijo and vice-president Sanetomi SANJO read the saimon (address to the gods) before the altar in place of the emperor.
In place of the Emperor, gijo and vice-president Sanetomi SANJO read the saimon (address to the gods) in front of the altar.

sen.e: In place of the Emperor, gijo and vice-president Sanetomi SANJO read the saimon (address to the gods) in front of the altar.

sen.j: 天皇みずから幣帛の玉串を捧げて神拝して再び着座。
sen.e: The emperor prayed to God offering heihaku tamagushi and took a seat again.
The Emperor prayed to God offering tamagushi (branch of a sacred tree) as heihaku (general term for offering to God) and took a seat again.
sen.cmt: emperor→Emperorにしました。幣帛・玉串の説明がないため補いました。（幣帛の玉串は「幣帛として玉串を捧げた」と解釈しました。）幣帛：神社で、神前に奉献するものの総称。玉串：幣帛の一。サカキなど常緑樹の小枝に紙の幣あるいは木綿をつけ神前に供えるもの。 （デジタル大辞泉（小学館））

sen.j: 三条が再び神前で御誓文を奉読し、続いて勅語を読み上げた。
sen.e: Sanjo read Charter Oath before the altar again and read Ordinance subsequently.
Sanjo read Charter Oath in front of the altar again and read Ordinance subsequently.

sen.j: その後、公卿・諸侯が一人ずつ神位と玉座に拝礼し、奉答書に署名した。
